column4: hi, can someone guide me through installing Gyachi on Intrepid? is it even possible? i didn't find .deb for intrepid, and terminal tar.gz install didn't work either
a IM yahoo client for linux
sorry, thought it was popular
check out pidgin
do you have the dev tools installed (compiler, etc) ?
try "sudo aptitude install build-essential" before trying to run configure
thx i'll try
then, when (if) ./configure complains about missing stuff, you'll have to install therelated " *-dev" packages
i just re-downloaded it .. the install.txt tells me to firstly run "./autogen.sh" then the usual configure, make, sudo make install
what does autogn say ? Why is it failing ?
http://paste.ubuntu.com/118649/
try `apt-get install libtool`
still didin't work...... http://paste.ubuntu.com/118651/
try `apt-get install autoconf automake`
thank you, that worked... well, at least i got past that step :) .. thanks again
gl :)
if you still remember my problem, can you check out this: http://paste.ubuntu.com/118653/
you are going to see this for each and every missing "....-dev" toolkit, although I'm not sure what the alsa on is (maybe `apt-get install alsa-dev` ?) .
k i'll look in synaptic maybe ...
synaptic won't help you much IMHO, when building from source you really have to read the README, especially the requirements bit ;)
i found the answer to the alsa problem .. thing is.. i don't know how to use it: "Install the alsa devel packages (using yast) and then try running ./configure again." ... how do i use yast ?
